description.narrative: Government welfare institutions and CSOs have the capacity to deliver protection services to children (boys and girls), including during humanitarian situations., which contributes to Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2020, increased numbers of children in Somalia are protected from all forms of abuse, neglect and exploitation

mailing-address.narrative: UNICEF Somalia Support Centre (USSC) P.O. Box 44145 - 00100 Nairobi

Services to prevent or respond to gender-based violence in emergencies

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Government welfare institutions and CSOs have the capacity to deliver protection services to children (boys and girls), including during humanitarian situations.

description.narrative: 331,457 were reached with protection services including 99,678 girls, 105,434 boys, 75,801 women and 50,535 men through the CP AoR. UNICEF is providing support to the CP Area of Responsibility to carry out a national child protection assessment | Status:On-track | As-of Date:10/02/2020

title.narrative: Existence of functioning government-led child protection coordination mechanisms at the state level

baseline.value: 2 out of 11 active sub working groups (Hargeisa, Garowe, Bosaso, Mogadishu, Baidoa, Dolow, Kismayo, Beletweyn, Berbera, Boroma, Luuq)

target.value: 2020:8 out of 11 (Hargeisa; Garowe; Mogadishu; Baidoa; Kismayo; Boroma + 2 TBD)

actual.value: 2019:National: 1 CSR: 5 CPWG NEZ: 4 CPWG NWZ: 6 (3CPWG, MTTF, 1-Inter-ministerial TF, 1 BR/CRVS TWG)

title.narrative: Number of UNICEF-targeted unaccompanied and separated girls and boys registered with family tracing and reunification services and family-based care or appropriate alternative services

actual.value: 2019:6,007 unaccompanied and separated children (2,674girls and 3,329 boys) provided with interim care services in IDP sites

title.narrative: Number of UNICEF-targeted children and women who experienced or at risk of experiencing sexual violence and received at least one kind of multi-sectoral support services in humanitarian situations

actual.value: 2019:3,990 GBV survivors (2,047 women, 1387 girls, 261 boys and 295 men) who accessed appropriate services

title.narrative: Percentage of UNICEF-targeted girls and boys in humanitarian situations provided with psychosocial support, including access to child friendly spaces with intersectoral programming interventions

actual.value: 2019:Data not available to calculate the perecentage - in absolute numbers - 66,230 children including 22,670 girls, 33,247 boys 6673 women & 3640 men

title.narrative: Number of UNICEF-targeted girls and boys recruited and used by armed forces and groups that have been released and reintegrated with their families and provided with adequate care and services

actual.value: 2019:970 children formerly associated with armed forces and groups (777 boys & 193 girls) and 201 other vulnerable children (111 boys & 90 girls) are under the care of UNICEF-supported reintegration programs
